project.teaser: Metals and minerals are key enablers for the European Green Deal and will substitute fossil fuels in the long run. At the same time, Europe is highly dependent on importing raw materials for its manufacturing industries and to accomplish the transition to a resource efficient...
project.objective:
Metals and minerals are key enablers for the European Green Deal and will substitute fossil fuels in the long run. At the same time, Europe is highly dependent on importing raw materials for its manufacturing industries and to accomplish the transition to a resource efficient, sustainable society. This is why the European Green Deal defines access to resources as a strategic security question for Europe’s ambition to develop into a green economy. To meet this challenge, the vision of EIT RawMaterials is to develop raw materials into a major strength for Europe. EIT RawMaterials’ mission is to advance Europe‘s transition to sustainability by driving innovation along the entire raw materials value chain. To fulfil the mission, three strategic objectives are addressed: securing raw materials supply; designing materials solutions; and closing materials loops.
EIT RawMaterials is the world’s largest and leading partnership in raw materials and closely connected with the policy agenda of the European Commission. The Knowledge and Innovation Community (KIC) is open to new partners from Regional Innovation Scheme (RIS) countries and small business and is driven by a strategy that creates industrial symbiosis through innovation across value chains. The European Raw Materials Alliance (ERMA) managed by EIT RawMaterials on behalf of the Commission is an important mechanism for translating projects into investments and infrastructures that contribute to creating added value and jobs for Europe within key strategic industrial ecosystems. These initiatives are complemented by EIT RawMaterials’ leading role in education and innovation activities, such as the EIT’s initiative in capacity building for Higher Education Institutions (HEI) and the European Commission’s European Innovation Area (EIA). Through these high-impact activities and the KIC’s talent, people and partner network, EIT RawMaterials has set the foundation to create impact and to achieve its strategic objectives.
project.title: EIT RawMatrials Business Plan 2023-2025
project.keywords: Raw Materials, Circular Economy, Innovation, Education, Entrepreneurship

article.title: Securing Europe’s metals and minerals supply

result.title: Multiannual Work plan – Business Plan per se 2023-2025
result.description: KIC Business Plan (Part B, excluding this appendix) to be published on KIC website with following information:- 2023-2025 KIC Calls Planning: timeline and call description [format to be agreed between EIT and KICs]. To be published together with BP per se, in the framework of ‘annual work plan’.- Budget: (i) Budget information (statement of revenues and expenditures planned in 2023-2025) and (ii) Staff planDocument to be published only after GA signature.(For other documents to be published on KIC website, see complete list in Art. 7.2 (e) of Partnership Agreement).

result.title: Call information and documentation - 2023
result.description: Documentation of project selection procedure 2023-2025.Main information published on KIC and EIT websites and on Funding & Tenders Portal (in line with the Commission’s template). Timeline for providing information will be agreed with EIT and Commission.

result.title: Call results and statistics - 2023
result.description: Statistics on number of applications, per country, per thematic topics; published on KIC website and EIT be informed; budget and funding overview; information on each activity selected for funding, including data on each participant and abstracts of the activity proposal, for publication purposes. EIT Core KPIs per activity published on KIC website and EIT to be informed.

result.title: Financial Sustainability targets for each EIT RIS Hub
result.description: Provide, by 31 March 2023, binding, multi-annual Financial Sustainability targets for each EIT RIS Hub.

result.title: Impact delivery targets for each EIT RIS Hub
result.description: Provide, by 31 March 2023, concrete, time-bound and measurable, multi-annual impact delivery targets for each EIT RIS Hub in fulfilment of the common list of EIT RIS Hub KPIs provided by the EIT.

result.title: Education Deliverables - 2024
result.description: Indluding: - Thematic deliverable Education: A report on the progress of the yearly implementation of the education portfolio, according to the mandatory template. The template contains also the annual report on EIT Label Programme.- Specific deliverable Education: Two reports submitted in one package on :1. KIC specific EIT labelling strategy and presenting a clear financial plan, updated annually and milestones and targets how the activities will become sustainable over time.2. Brief annual report on implementation of the EIT Label program (as required in the EIT Label Handbook).

result.title: HE results platform dissemination report - 2024

result.title: RIS Hubs Interim Report
result.description: Report on the implementation of the country-specific roadmaps and the performance of EIT RIS Hubs.

result.title: The ranking lists and short summaries of the projects/activities - 2023
result.description: Ranking lists will be shared with EIT end of evaluation, including experts’ evaluation results and subsequent KIC management decisions. KIC will send short summaries of each project content.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
